result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan Thomas Fleming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF540

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CF6.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF6.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to participate in the MRT Program or a program equivalent.
-Defendant to pursue post high school education and/or employment.
-Defendant to obtain a valid driver's license.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros, DF: Donovan Thomas Fleming appeared from jail.  Court called at 2:45 p.m. Set for SEH.  Includes case 15CF540 & 16CF06.  Court and attorneys have reviewed the PSI.  Attorneys make argument.  

Amended Ct. 1 in 15CF540 
Sentence I/S  7 years total, 3 years initial and 4 years ES
175 days credit against ultimate sentence
- DE eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program
4 years probation with conditions:
- 6 months conditional time in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for good time
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy
 -Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- DE to participate in the MRT program or a program equivalent
- DE to pursue post high school education or employment
- DE to obtain valid driver's license
- Submit to a DNA sample and pay a surcharge of $250.00
- Court costs of $268.00
- Cost to be paid through the DOC

Amended Ct. 1 (Misdemeanor Battery) in 16CF06 to run concurrent to 15CF540
Sentence I/S 9 months in the St. Croix County Jail
- 1 year probation with conditions
- Submit to a DNA sample and pay a surcharge of $200.00
- Court costs of $243.00
- Cost to be paid through the DOC

*DE on a PO Hold.  Court stays until Monday, May 9th
*DE to sign up for probation while in custody

- 20 days to appeal

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Donovan Thomas Fleming appeared from jail. Case called at 11:07. Includes 15CF540, 16CF06. Court files an amended information. ADA Minser requests a new date for sentencing. Atty. Petros agrees.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 in 15CF540 and amended Ct. 1 in 16CF06. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 in 15CF540 to a class E felony and amended Ct 1 in 16CF06 to misdemeanor battery. On motion of the state without objection the Court dismisses Ct. 2 in 15CF540. Court orders a PSI. Court revokes bail. Atty.'s to schedule sentencing with the Atty's. about 60 days out.
filed by ADA Edward Minser. eif
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-18-2016 11:00 am

On. 16CF06 Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading.  NG. Atty. Petros believes they are close to a resolution. Bonds continue. Arraignment at 02-12-2016 01:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Donovan Thomas Fleming appeared from jail. Case called at 9:00. Includes 15CF540 (STC), 16CF06 (PH). ADA Minser. S/T Sargent J. Miller. Direct by ADA Minser. Sgt. Miller identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. Petros. Court questions Sgt. Miller. Court orders State to maintain any video recording. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. There has been an offer extended. Speedy trial demand for 15CF540 expires on 03-12-2015. JT on the 15CF540 will be taken off at this time.  Arraignment scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Atty. C. Petros. gme
Preliminary hearing at 02-02-2016 09:00 am

per Defendant's bond. eif
Pre-trial conference at 01-12-2016 04:30 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely LIMITED CONTACT with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kevin R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew L Hartung,   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Donovan Thomas Fleming appeared from jail via video.
